title: Federal Hall National Memorial: Laws & Policies
body: Laws & Policies       Superintendent's Compendium The Superintendent's Compendium covers Designations, Closures, Permit Requirements and other Restrictions. Downloadable copy of the Compendium  Â    Firearms in National Parks The law governing possession of firearms inside national parks changed on February 22, 2010. Visitors may possess firearms within a national park unit provided they comply with federal, state, and local laws. The role of responsible gun owners is to know and obey the federal, state, and local laws governing the parks they are visiting. For more information about New York gun laws, please visit this website: http://public.leginfo.state.ny.us/menuf.cgi  Please remember that federal law prohibits firearms in certain park facilities and buildings. These places are marked with signs at public entrances.
